title: How to Disable Parental Controls on Android

steps.title: Open the Play Store .
steps.content: Open the Play Store . You'll find the Play Store's briefcase icon in the app drawer..

steps.title: Tap the ☰ menu.
steps.content: Tap the ☰ menu. It's the three horizontal lines at the top-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . It's about halfway down the menu. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Parental Controls.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Parental Controls . It's under the "User controls" header toward the middle of the menu. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Slide the "Parental controls are on" switch to Off position.
steps.content: Slide the "Parental controls are on" switch to Off position. It's the switch at the top-right corner of the screen. [4] X Research source If you just want to remove restrictions on one category, tap that category instead, select your desired rating, and then tap SAVE .

steps.title: Enter your four-digit PIN and tap OK.
steps.content: Enter your four-digit PIN and tap OK . Use the same PIN you used to set up Parental Controls on this Android. Once your PIN is accepted, all Play Store downloads will be permitted.

steps.title: Open the Family Link app on the parent's phone or tablet.
steps.content: Open the Family Link app on the parent's phone or tablet. If you manage your child's account with Google Family link and wish to stop supervising their account, use this method. The Family Link app is the white icon with blue, yellow, and green flag. If the child is not yet 13, you won't be able to completely disable supervision. [5] X Research source You can, however, disable Parental Controls for their Google Play Store downloads.

steps.title: Tap the account you want to manage.
steps.content: Tap the account you want to manage.

steps.title: Tap Controls on Google Play to manage Play Store Parental Controls.
steps.content: Tap Controls on Google Play to manage Play Store Parental Controls. If the child is over 13 and you want to disable all supervision, skip to the next step. To remove parental controls in the Play Store: [6] X Research source Tap the type of content you want to allow. Choose how much access you'd like the child to have to the specified content. Tap SAVE to save your changes.

steps.title: Tap Account Info.
steps.content: Tap Account Info . Information about the child's account will appear. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Stop supervision.
steps.content: Tap Stop supervision . A warning message will appear. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Stop Supervision and follow the on-screen instructions.
steps.content: Tap Stop Supervision and follow the on-screen instructions. The remaining on-screen steps will walk you through the process of removing Family Link services from your child's Android phone or tablet. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Open your Android's Settings .
steps.content: Open your Android's Settings . You can do this quickly by dragging down the notification panel from the top of the home screen and tapping the gear at the top-right corner. [10] X Research source This method requires you to delete your Google Play Store settings and create a brand new PIN to replace the old one. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Apps & notifications.
steps.content: Tap Apps & notifications . This section may be called Applications or Apps on some Androids.

steps.title: Tap Google Play Store.
steps.content: Tap Google Play Store . You may have to scroll down to find it.

steps.title: Tap Storage.
steps.content: Tap Storage . If you see Clear storage you can tap that instead. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Clear data and then OK to confirm.
steps.content: Tap Clear data and then OK to confirm. This deletes your saved Play Store data, including all parental control settings. [13] X Research source
